Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: I spent hours looking for a supplier for us well endowed ladies! Just a tip. Have a look at the Anita comfort bra. I have found it to be so comfortable. It has wide shoulder straps and more importantly a wide support round the side as if you are having lymph nodes removed you will have also have some swelling which will be cushioned under band. I also went one side larger is 40g as you won't want it too tight around you and you will find it hard to fasten for a while. I also work in an office and no way was I going back to work braless to scare the customers! You will be fine once you get your head around it. The waiting is horrible but you will feel so relieved soon x
Posts.Title: Having left sided masectomy without reconstruction in 2 weeks, please...

Posts.Content: Hi try womanzone.co.uk as I found this was the only site I could order larger cup sizes. They have a good range of comfy post op bras and you can say which side you need the pocket. I also had left side MX early December and whilst it is mentally a hard process once you accept what's going to happen you can come to terms with it. I also looked at scar straight away and it wasn't too bad. You will definitely be better with front fastening blouses flowing down.  As a G  cup myself front fastening clothes really helped in the weeks after surgery when wearing a bra was impossible. Accompanied by a pretty scarf you can get them cheap in charity shops gave me a feeling of privacy down the front.  Also bought lots of ladies vests which I actually stepped into and pulled up my body as no way could I lift up my left arm for quite a while.  As others have said be kind to yourself and take little baby steps one day at a time. Good luck. Andrea x
